```{=html} ``` ### [EDUCATION]{.underline} #### SUNY University at Buffalo August 2024 – December 2025 (Expected) ##### Second Year Graduate Student - Master of Science in Geographic Information Science Buffalo, NY ▪ Cumulative GPA: 4.0/4.0 ▪ Current enrolled courses (Fall 2025): GIS and Machine Learning, Dynamic Modeling ▪ Teaching Assistant for Global Climate Change and Maps: Earth from Above ▪ Secretary for Geography Graduate Student Association
#### SUNY University at Buffalo February 2023 ##### Bachelor of Science, Environmental Geoscience Buffalo, NY ▪ 3.76/4.0 GPA, summa cum laude ▪ Teaching assistant for Ecological Methods
### [WORK EXPERIENCE]{.underline} #### Geocove, Inc. (Part-time) November 2024 – Current ##### GIS Technician Cheektowaga, NY ▪ Refactored and debugged 23 deprecated R scripts generating updated geospatial datasets, integrating most recent U.S. Census and OpenStreetMap data to be used for a New York City MTA toolkit ▪ Annotated over 1,000 emergency disaster-related tweets for a NSF-funded GeoAI research project focused on developing AI models to geolocate disaster areas for emergency management. ▪ Converted Python 2.x geoprocessing scripts to Python 3.x to support the migration from ArcMap to ArcGIS Pro ▪ Developed automation scripts utilizing ArcPy to perform routine data backups and archiving of AGOL and Portal features ▪ Worked with ArcGIS Pro to update various types of vector data and facilitated the migration of old datasets to ESRI solutions. ▪ Effectively communicated with public and private stakeholders to achieve better project alignment for goals, timelines, and deliverables. #### Watts Architecture & Engineers (Full-time) March 2024 – November 2024 ##### Air Sampling Technician and Project Monitor/i> Buffalo, NY ▪ Conducted environmental air sample tests for harmful regulated building material debris. ▪ Communicated and addressed issues to contractors and clients regarding NYSDOL ICR-56 ▪ Recorded, analyzed, and utilized project records to create project closeout reports and deliverables for clients #### WNY Partnership for Regional Invasive Species (Seasonal Full-time) May 2023 – September 2023 ##### Invasive Species Management Assistant Buffalo, NY ▪ Gathered invasive species data using ESRI Survey123 and Field Maps in the Western New York jurisdiction ▪ Utilized iMapInvasive and ArcGIS Pro to create Management and Survey Reports for stakeholders
### [SKILLS AND COURSES TAKEN]{.underline} Skills: Intermediate Python, Intermediate R, Beginner SQL, familiarity with ESRI products (ArcGIS Pro, ArcPy, Experience Builder, Field Maps, Survey123), Visual Basic, ImageJ, and ENVI Courses Taken: Spatial Data Science, Advance Remote Sensing, GIS in Environmental Modeling, Integrated Environmental Management, Environmental Engineering
